duck: Reliability Engineering - Reliability engineering is an engineering field that deals with the study, evaluation, and life-cycle management of reliability: the ability of a system or component to perform its required func...
exergy - In thermodynamics, the exergy of a system is the maximum useful work possible during a process that brings the system into equilibrium with a heat reservoir.
Reliability, availability and serviceability (RAS) - Reliability, availability, and serviceability are computer hardware engineering terms.
availability heuristic - The availability heuristic is a mental shortcut that occurs when people make judgments about the probability of events by how easy it is to think of examples.
availability definition: the quality or state of being available.
Safety Engineering - Safety engineering is an engineering discipline which assures that engineered systems provide acceptable levels of safety.
Spurious trip level - Spurious Trip Level (STL) is defined as a discrete level for specifying the spurious trip requirements of safety functions to be allocated to safety systems.

wiki.text:
In reliability theory and reliability engineering, the term 'availability' has
the following meanings:

* The degree to which a system, subsystem or equipment is in a specified
  operable and committable state at the start of a mission, when the mission is
  called for at an unknown, i.e. a random, time. Simply put, availability is the
  proportion of time a system is in a functioning condition. This is often
  described as a 'mission capable rate'. Mathematically, this is expressed as 1
  minus unavailability.
* The ratio of (a) the total time a functional unit is capable of being used
  during a given interval to (b) the length of the interval.

For example, a unit that is capable of being used 100 hours per week (168 hours)
would have an availability of 100/168. However, typical availability values are
specified in decimal (such as 0.9998). In high availability applications, a
metric known as nines, corresponding to the number of nines following the
decimal point, is used. In this system, "five nines" equals 0.99999 (or 99.999%)
availability.
wiki.title: availability
